title: Arsenal chief claims Mesut Ozil's training work ethic is behind Unai Emery snub
text:

Raul Sanllehi has indicated that Mesut Ozil's attitude in training is behind the midfielder's lack of game-time for Arsenal .

The 30-year-old has made just two appearances for the Premier League club this season, with Unai Emery preferring the likes of Dani Ceballos and Joe Willock in his starting XI.

Ozil was left out of Gunners' squad for the recent games with Manchester United , Standard Liege and Bournemouth , increasing suggestions that the club are looking to offload the former Germany international in January.

It has been reported that Ozil's repeated absences are a result of his failure to impress Arsenal boss Emery in training and the Spaniard has made no secret of his belief that other members of his squad deserve to play ahead of the playmaker.

And when asked about the midfielder's current status in the team, Head of Football Sanllehi also suggested that the former Real Madrid star needs to increase his work ethic to reclaim his place in the side.

(Image: Arsenal FC via Getty Images)

Speaking at a fan's forum meeting on Thursday, Sanllehi said ( via REDaction Gooners ): "Unai's policy has always been to play the ones that work hard in training."

After playing 35 times in all competitions for Arsenal last season, Ozil's only appearances of the current campaign have come during September's 2-2 draw with Watford and the Carabao Cup win over Nottingham Forest.

Despite impressing in both matches and persistent calls from fans to see him play more, the midfielder has not featured since.

When asked about the decision to omit the German from the Europa League squad that beat Standard Liege 4-0 last week, Emery explained: I am thinking every time to decide the best players for each match and the best players in the squad to play and to help us.

(Image: Arsenal FC via Getty Images)

"When I decided he shouldn’t be in the squad it’s because I think other players deserved it more.

Arsenal entered the international break third in the Premier League table after a mixed start to the season which has seen the Gunners claim 15 points from their first eight matches.

After finishing fifth last season, Sanllehi also indicated that breaking into the top four his Emery's target this time around.

He added: "We said to Unai that we just missed out on qualifying for the CL last year, but this year with a stronger squad, we expect you to do that".
description: The former Germany international has played just two games for the Gunners this season
